3. You slam a creature up to 1 size category larger than you up to 3sq per Ki Mark you used.  Creatures who hit a surface are slammed for 4 Verve Loss per square you moved them.  Resolve a Trip with no bonus against creatures that do not hit a surface.

name: Ki Self Expertise
description:
When resolving Ki Flow and using this Expertise, expend up to your Expertise score in Ki Marks from targets within your Threatened Area and choose one of the following effects:
1. If in combat, you reduce the duration of a Status at a rate of 1 round per Ki Mark expended.
2. If in combat, you restore 5 Verve per Mark.
3. You become enveloped in Pyral, Luminal, Umral, Arcanic or Zephyral energy for 1 Round per Ki Mark expended.  You gain the Energy Shielded Status (DC 1) for 1 round per Ki Mark.
4. You gain 2sq of Movement this turn per Ki Mark expended, and you may treat difficult terrain, water, gaseous, vertical surfaces, falling, and occupied spaces as normal spaces.

name: Ki Eye
description: When resolving Ki Flow and using this Expertise, expend up to your Expertise score in Ki Marks from targets within your Threatened Area.  You automatically resolve Block and Dodge a number of times equal to the Ki Marks you expended, which can be applied to most Special Attacks as well.  Additionally, you may resolve this as a Reaction to an opponent's Move.  For each attack you avoided, apply a Ki Mark to the attacker at the end of the turn.

name: Ki Catalyst
description: Apply a Ki Mark to yourself for each enemy you kill or completely disable.

name: Ki Ranged Diversion
description: When resolving Dodge against a Ranged Attack, if you successfully Dodge, you may Expend a Ki Mark on yourself or the Ranged Attacker and choose a new target for the projectile that is within 45(deg) of the flight path of the projectile.  If the projectile is dangerous to handle (for example flaming arrows), you incur the attack as well as your new target.

name: Ki Presence
description: When Ki Attuned, you can apply Ki Marks by thrown weapons to targets within 5sq, instead of just by touch.

name: Ki Point Status
description: When expending Ki Marks on targets, including yourself, that have a negative Status Effect and at least 1 Ki Mark, treat the creature as having one additional Ki Mark.

name: Rage
description:
You have the ability to enter a Rage.  If you ever reach 0 Raging you gain the Prone Status, and you can no longer gain Raging for the remainder of the Combat.  On any turn that you do not use the Melee Attack or Unnerve Moves, lose 3 Raging.  Whenever you deal Damage to a target, or receive Damage from any source, you gain a Raging.

If you ever reach 10 Raging, then at the end of your turn you gain the Unstoppable Rage Status.

name: Rage
description: If you are not already, you enter a Combat Rage, gaining a number of Raging equal to half of your points in Rage.  If you are already in a Combat Rage, gain 1 Raging.

name: Unnerving Rage Expertise
description:
When resolving Rage and using this Expertise, choose one of the following effects:
1. You may apply the Unnerve Move to additional targets equal to half your Expertise.  Lose 1 Raging per target you choose.
2. You may move a number of opponents equal to your Expertise 1sq away from you, if there is a safe square to do so.  Lose 1 Raging per target you choose.
3. You unnerve a number of opponents equal to half your Expertise.  Until your next turn, Critical Hit Raw Rolls apply with a +1 Bonus.  Lose 1 Raging per target you choose.

name: Metabolic Rage Expertise
description:
When resolving Rage and using this Expertise, choose one of the following effects:
1. Expend up to your Expertise in Raging to add 1sq to your leap distance and height this turn.
2. Ignore the effects of any Mental Status, or the Damage Over Time Status this turn.  Lose 2 Raging per DC of the Status.
3. Expend up to your Expertise in Raging to add +3 Verve Loss to all Melee Attacks this turn, or +1/2 to the Grapple or Trip Moves.

name: Powerful Rage Expertise
description:
When resolving Rage and using this Expertise, choose one of the following effects:
1. You slam a creature within your Threatened Area into a surface or another creature up to 1 sq per Raging spent.  For each sq your target moves, both your target and the surface or creature it hits incurs 5 Verve Loss per sq moved.
2. You stab and slice a creature, applying the Damage Over Time (DC 2) Status to them.  Lose 5 Raging.
3. Resolve one Melee Combat Move (with no Expertises) against up to 3 targets in a Line Shape beginning from you.  You end your turn in a free square adjacent to your last target.  Lose 8 Raging.

name: Brutal Sympathy
description: When you have the Combat Rage Status, gain 1 Raging every time an ally takes Damage.

name: Brutal Rebuke
description: When you have the Combat Rage Status, gain 1 Rage every time you successfully resolve Block and Dodge.

name: Brutal Kill
description: When you have the Combat Rage Status, gain 2 Rage every time you kill a target.

name: Roaring Relocate
description: You may once expend 1 Rage to ignore occupied spaces of opponents up to 1 size category larger, when using Relocate.  You may move any target that you push through to an adjacent safe square.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.

name: Roaring Presence
description: You may once expend 1 Rage to gain 3UDR against one source this turn.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.

name: Roaring Leap
description: You may once expend 1 Rage to gain +2sq of movement when resolving your Relocate Action.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.

name: Channel Divinity
description: You Channel the very power of the gods via your Source to bring your divine will to those around you.  After a Long Rest, you gain a number of Divinity equal to your Channel Divinity, losing any unused Divinity you already had.

name: Lay on Hands
description: While in combat, you may spend a Divinity to Restore the Verve of a target by 1 Verve per point in Channel Divinity.

name: Holy Word
description: You may spend a Divinity to attempt to rebuke up to half your Channel Divinity of Undead targets that you can perceive.  If you beat their Defence (CHA), you apply the Frightened Status to them.

name: Blessing
description: You may spend a Divninity to grant one target you can perceive +1 to their next Move Roll.

name: Righteous Weapon
description: You may spend a Divninity to create a weapon appropriate to your deity.  This weapon is treated as a fine weapon and is magical for the purposes of beating resistances.  It replaces any weapon you are currently wielding, and lasts for 1 turn.

name: Blessed Healer Expertise
description: When resolving Lay on Hands and using this Expertise, you Restore an additional 2 Verve per Expertise.  When you have at least 4 points, Verve acquired this way is Gained instead.

name: Powerful Rebuke Expertise
description: When resolving Holy Word and using this Expertise, you can target additional creature types based on your Expertise.  1: Beasts.  2: Humanoids.  3: Fae, Abberation and Demonic.  4: Monstrous.  Additionally, at 5 points you instead apply Terrified.  And at 6 points your targets incur 10 Verve Loss.

name: Blessful Expertise
description: When resolving Blessing and using this Expertise, you may apply Blessing to a number of additional targets equalto your Expertise.

name: Holy Arms Expertise
description: When resolving Righteous Weapon and using this Expertise, your weapon applies an additional Verve Loss at 1, 3 and 5 Expertise, and it lasts one turn longer at 2, 4 and 6 Expertise.

name: Blood Word
description: When resolving Holy Word, you gain +3 to beat the Defences of any creature that applied a Status or reduced your Verve Loss last turn.

name: Blessing Channel II
description: Resolve the Blessing Move as a Quick Action.

name: Rhapsody
description: Something about your form, your movement, your voice, and your creations is beyond those of even the greatest creatives.  By weaving energies of your Source into your performance and creations, you can enact amazing feats of inspiration and uplifiting of the spirit.  When resolving Performance, Create Artwork, Cooking or Rhapsodic Creation, you may use the Skill of either Creativity or Rhapsody as your Roll Bonus.

name: Rhapsodic Creation
description: You create or reveal a Rhapsodic work: a performance, a song, a scent, or even an object of art or work of wondrous cooking.  Resolve a Rhapsodic Creation and note the DC Rank you beat.  The first time a target experiences this work, they Gain 1 Verve per DC rank of your Creation starting at DC 0.  You may apply this effect to a number of targets equal to half your Rhapsody Score.  If your creation is art or food that you created earlier, you may apply this effect when you first reveal it, however you may only have 1 creation stored.  You are considered under the effect of a Rhapsodic Creation if you were the target of Rhapsodic Creation in this combat or if Rhapsodic Creation has allowed you to Gain Verve above your total which you still have.

name: Weave Expertise
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation and using this Expertise, you attempt to copy part of the effect of a Spell that you could see being Cast this round.  You resolve Cast a Spell as Free Action copying the spell with new targets of your choice, however all numeric effects are reduced by [6|5|4|3|2|1] including duration, to a minimum of 1.

name: Creation Expertise
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation and using this Expertise, instead of the normal resolution, you grant anyone under the effects of a Rhapsodic Creation may exchange [14|12|10|8|6|4] Verve to apply one of the following Statuses to themselves: Enlivened: Inspired, Enlivened: Uplifted, Fortified (5), or to increase the duration of a positive Status already on them by 3 turns, or to reduce the duration of a negative Status on them by 1.

name: Uplifting Creation
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation, you also apply the Enlivened: Uplifted Status to your targets.  You may not apply the effects of another Passive.

name: Inspired Creation
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation, you also apply the Enlivened: Inspired Status to your targets.  You may not apply the effects of another Passive.

name: Sympathetic Creation
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation, you also copy a positive Status (including remaining duration) on one of your targets to another of your targets, if you exceed the DC of the copied Status.  You may not apply the effects of another Passive.

name: Unsympathetic Creation
description: When resolving Rhapsodic Creation, you also remove a negative Status (including remaining duration) on one of your targets, optionally applying it to another targets that you can perceive, if you exceed the DC of the copied Status.  You may not apply the effects of another Passive.

name: Cymbal Clash
description: Whenever you successfully resolve Block and Dodge, reset the duration of any Status applied by a Rhapsodic Creation that is in effect, on one target.

name: Rhapsodic Presence
description: Your presence is felt in your movements, your voice and your creations, and when you focus you can control how you project this feeling.  Resolve Rhapsodic Presence and note how many DC Ranks you beat, starting at DC 0.  You gain 2 Presence for each rank you beat, and with some other passives you will be able to use them for interesting effects using Rhapsody Passives.

name: Facilitating Presence
description: As a Free Action you may spend a Presence to replace one die that calculates Damage or Healing with the value of [4|5|6|7|8|9].  You may use this a maximum of once per turn.

name: Discordant Presence
description:
As a Free Action you may spend 2 Presence to perform a Raw Roll when an enemy resolves a Basic Attack or Move, choosing one of the below effects.  You may only use this on each creature once per turn.
-- On [20|20|19|19|19|18]+ the Move does not occur and the originator of the Move cannot replace it.
-- On a [20|19|18|17|16|15]+ the originator of the Move must choose a new target, if there is another valid target.  This does not apply to Area of Effect or Aura abilities.

name: Requiem Presence
description: As a Free Action you may spend 1 Presence to apply [4|6|8|10|12|14] Verve Loss to a creature.  You may use this a maximum of once per turn.  This Verve Loss is only reduced by MRes and URes.

name: Harmonic Chorus
description: If an ally resolves a Creativity Move to help you and beats a DC of 1, then until the end of your next turn, you gain a +1 Bonus to Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence.  This increases to a +2 Bonus if they beat a DC of 2.

name: Noooooooo!
description: If one of your allies has entered the Incapacitated state this turn, the Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence Move is a Quick Action this turn.

name: Tragic Artist
description: When under the effect of a negative spell, effect, or Status, you gain a +1 bonus to the Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence Move.

name: Final Song
description: If you gain the Incapacitated Status you automatically resolve and apply Rhapsodic Performance with either the Uplifting or Inspired Creation Passive.

name: Kineticist
description: You have the ability to manipulate astral energy within your body into kinetic energies.

name: Spark Kinetics
description: You Spark Kinetics, making Kinetics your sole Psionic Focus.

name: Manifest Kinetics
description: You Manifest a Kinetic Power from the Kinetics Power List, if you have the available PSI.

name: Draw Kinetics
description: You stop and charge your Psionic Power from the Eternal Horizon, gaining 2 PSI.

name: Kinetic Draw Expertise
description: If you successfully Dodged a target last turn, you may use Kinetics to Draw.

name: Delayed Kinetics
description: You may hold your Stealth Move until a condition arises before your next turn.  If that condition doesn't arise, you lose your Stealth

name: Quieted Kinetics
description: When not in a tense situation, you can hide the visual or mental feedback of your Kinetic Manifestation

name: Manipulation Expertise
description: You may perform any action you could do with two hands, from afar.  Items manipulated cannot weight more than 1kg.

name: Absolute Quieted Kinetics
description: When not in a tense situation, you can hide both the visual and mental feedback of your Kinetic Manifestation

name: Kinetic Talent: Kinetics
description: With Kinetics Sparked, you may levitate small objects weighing no more than 1kg at a speed of 6sq.

name: Kinetic Talent: Dodge
description: You gain +1 to the Dodge Move until your next turn.

name: Kinetic Talent: Motion
description: You gain +1 Movement Speed until your next turn.

name: Kinetic Talent Master
description: Your Kinetic Talents this turn are Free Actions.

name: Clairsenticist
description: You have the ability to read the whims of astral energies as future and past sight, as well as mental resonances

name: Spark Clairsentience
description: You Spark Clairsentience, making Clairsentience your sole Psionic Focus.

name: Manifest Clairsentience
description: You Manifest a Clairsentience Power from the Clairsentience Power List, if you have the available PSI.

name: Draw Clairsentience
description: You stop and charge your Psionic Power from the Eternal Horizon, gaining 2 PSI.

name: Clairsentient Draw Expertise
description: If you successfully [ condition ], you may use Clairsentience to Draw as a Quick Action.
